definition: can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
thousand
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to buy/to purchase

sentences.english: Isn't this a priceless morning, madam ?
sentences.chinese: 真是個千金難買的早晨，夫人。

sentences.english: The value of a university education is priceless.
sentences.chinese: 大學教育的益處是千金難買的。

sentences.english: Money doesn't buy is friends and more spring often leave.
sentences.chinese: 千金難買是朋友，朋友多了春常留。

sentences.english: Good health is an invaluable blessing.
sentences.chinese: 身體健康是千金難買的福氣。

definition: toil/hard work
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
red in the face/extremely angry
a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to be successful in every endeavor
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
shameful performance/disgraceful situation
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
lingering fear
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
at one's ease/carefree
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
